data.title: If engineer captures a building there is no warning sound
data.body:
We need some kind of warning sound if your buildings are being captured by an engineer. E.g. the "building under attack" standard sound or even better something like "buldings being captured". 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/873416-if-engineer-captures-a-building-there-is-no-warning-sound?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Search Bar for Maps
data.body:
With all the new maps coming in to circulation, it would be a good idea to add a search bar to the "Choose map" section
and possibly add some map size filters or whatever.

(Ripley`)

data.title: "every" unit can hit a walled up building
data.body:
Playtest 902
regardless what unit,bullet or angle ... everything can hit a building behind a wall  

http://imgur.com/cFbZwG4

data.title: Mines destroying friend and own vehicles.
data.body: Playing the stable release and my own vehicles where driving over my mines and blowing themselves up, allies vehicles were doing the same.

data.title: New (shared) Gamemode
data.body:
Would love to se some additional options in multiplayer, It would be cool if you could select so teams can use one (or all) of three options.

Option 1: Shared Power - easy explanation, all team members shares power.

Option 2: Shared Economy - also easy. all team members share the same resources, this game mode could be fun in the way that if one player uses to much of the economy to fuel his warfront, the other player will be lacking on his warfront, and so on.. A nice balance must be found.

Option 3: Shared controls - This is awesome for new players that might need some guiding or if for a diffrent type of gamemode. In this gamemode the teams are locked, (i'll let you guys decide if you start with one MCV or if all players in the team get their own MCV). either way, all units are controlable by all players, that way a player thats not that experienced can experience head on and even help another player ingame.

data.title: Tank turrets scanning for targets
data.body:
In almost every command and conquer game the tanks always pointed their turrets towards their target, it diden't mather if they were attacking or moving.

This should be added ingame as this can actully be used as way to detecte where someone would attack in advance, as such you would need to move smaller distances rather then to attack from one point of the map to the other to avoid getting your plans detected.

As a bonus we should also add so that tank turrets turn randomly (But not to much) when idling, so they face diffrentently... i remember RA3 using this, they only made so that the turret would turn 15 degrees or so from one side or the other every now and then, not enough to make it annoying, but just enough so it wont get boring.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/872883-tank-turrets?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Update civilian.yaml
data.body: Changed armor type of barrels to none so they can be shot by Tonya, Snipers, or other weapons with damage only applying to armor type none.

data.title: Unit commandbar
data.body:
I think this will save us alot of headache in the future.

The idea is to have a small commandbar for units so that we can have specific unit commands for special units.

i.ex. Generals uses a HUGE commandbar, Good example is the humvee that can be upgraded on a per unit basis with drones.

Better example. RA3 have a very small commandbar for units that could be used for secial functions ranging from a button to order aircraft to return to base ASAP or maybe have tanks that can have deployable smoke grenades. (it will also enrich the modding experiences some)

Implemented in:
- [x] RA #13488
- [x] TD #13442
- [x] D2k #13552
- [x] TS #13802

## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/872886-unit-commandbar?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Encyclopedia
data.body:
Something that might take a while to add but would be totaly worth it imo.

In Dune 2 you could check an encyclopedia with all units in that game.

We could use something like that in openRA (it wont be much use when you play multiplayer, but it will be a nice touch imo)

A good example here is the game "Battle for Wesnoth".

data.title: Spawn child unit that attacks target
data.body:
Would love to see this function in OpenRA.

In short. A unit should be able to spawn a child unit that attacks the target for the master unit, if child gets destroyed, it will be automatically replaced after a set amount of time.

Example. Red Alert 2 - Allied Destroyer - It has a main gun to bombard coastal target, and a Osprey Helicopter docked in the rear that will lift of and bomb enemy subs.

Example 2. Red Alert 2 - Allied Carrier - It's a ship that launches 3 fighters that attacks a target from very long range. If a fighter gets shot down, it will replace it after a set amount of time.

It would be even better if you could set it so that it either replace units auto. or that the player need to pay to replace the unit (might be hard to code in)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/871953-spawn-child-unit-that-attacks-target?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Update weapons.yaml
data.body: Updated so Tonya won't shoot at anything but infantry, as her weapon is ineffective against anything else anyway.

data.title: Tonya use sniper logic.
data.body: Tonya shouldn't shoot at tanks or buildings the same way the sniper does, except for C4ing buildings that is.

data.title: Update CHANGELOG for the September release.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Putting this up for proof-reading and other suggestions.

Note: This shouldn't be merged until immediately before the release, after updating the release date and any comments.

data.title: Filter AI targets based on what it can actually attack.
data.body: Fixes #3763.

data.title: Deviator description is inconsistent

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: The description claims that it only works against infantry, but in practice it only works against vehicles.

data.title: Change hotkey settings upon single key press
data.body:
I think the way that hotkeys are settable is bad (at least, it's not optimal).

Currently, it's a textfield in which you can type all kind of characters:

![screenshot002](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/1064606/d93ca9b6-1341-11e3-8150-280d7a777865.png)

I think hotkeys (in textfields) should change as soon as the player presses a key.

And if a hotkey has already been set elsewhere, a warning could appear, informing that the same hotkey is already affected to another action/command.

data.title: Corrected .Net Version and resulting ambiguous references.
data.body: Corrected TargetFramework in all .csproj and resulting Lazy ambiguous references.

data.title: Removed sequences/map.yaml everywhere
data.body: after helping someone at http://www.moddb.com/games/openra/#4073425

data.title: Updated to SharpFont 2.5.0.1
data.body: Few commits since I last compiled this manually. This just brings us in line with upstream https://github.com/Robmaister/SharpFont

data.title: Use Travis for deployment
data.body: http://about.travis-ci.org/docs/user/deployment/custom/ might have everything we need. We get #2635 for free and do not depend on the few people who have SSH access to build.open-ra.org to create a new release.

data.title: Live display adjustments
data.body:
It could be interesting to be able to modify some display settings without restarting:
- [ ] Changing the Display mode without restarting: windowed, fullscreen, pseudo-fullscreen (according to pchote on IRC, it _could_ be possible with SDL 2 #3315)
- [ ] Live window resizing (in windowed mode)

Requirement:
- [ ] Get rid of explicit widget positioning in UI #5625

data.title: Cleaned up the palette code
data.body: Removed a platform specific Mono hack workaround and did otherwise only minor source code formatting.

data.title: AI bridge repair
data.body:
When all bridges are down and there are no other alternative ways the AI should train engineers to repair the bridges.

Right now they stop operating on the land after all routes are blocked.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/871285-ai-bridge-repair?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Rough anti-basewalk terrain
data.body:
I suggest a new terrain type which units can pass (to avoid mazes that serve as a stress test for the path-finder), but you can't build upon. All the tiles with rubble and debris, could convert to it.

<bountysource-plugin>

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Disable parts of the tech tree when a building gets powered down
data.body:
to punish people powering down their radar all the time. I noticed this behavior in C&C 3: Tiberium Wars.

data.title: EjectOnDeath should take cargo in account
data.body: This applies to chinook and maybe badgers, too. They should eject a configurable percentage of their cargo when they got hit.
